This game is simply awesome...The story mode is fairly easy, but if you're looking for a big challenge you can try to beat the Bonus Maps(they're almost impossible).The game has also a very interesting and funny story that you'll most certainly enjoy...It's a very good game and I advise you to buy it '-'

Ein Ego-Shooter ohne Waffen: Das ist Portal. Erstaunliches Konzept, toller Humor. Dachte, ich hätte das ewige Rätselraten bei Computerspielen für Linux über, aber dieses mal war's echt unterhaltend. Obwohl es ein altes Spiel ist: Klare Empfehlung.
Do yourself a service and play this!

Do I need to say something about this game that hasn't already been said? Fantastic and very fun game that never lets down his momentum during the story; indeed, it may look linear, but it has some secrets inside that makes the player think about it and fantasize about what could've really happened in Aperture Laboratories before. The puzzles are challenging but not impossible at all in the story mode, and if you're searching for some more advanced stages you have additional stages with higher difficulty. Not to forget the funniest NPC of all time, GLados <3 SHIT'S PRETTY CASH OK?
I LOVE THIS GAME SO HARD! Not for people who give up easily. 9/10, would play again.
es un juegazo que te va a enganchar desde que lo cojas hasta que acabes la segunda parte,querras pasar todas las pruebas
Brilliant!

I have heard a lot about this game being pretty good but only by the few friends that played it, and so i gave it a chance. I must say for its age it does not show too much and the gameplay is incredible. Normally i will play a puzzle  or platformer once in a great while as fps and open world is more of my style, but this game had me hooked from the quirky humor to the countless deaths on some puzzles trying to figure it out. I must warn you it is quite short when compared to many of the campaigns from current and even other yesturyear games, but my final words are...just try it.
Unique 3D logical puzzles. Every strategic player should play this.

Portal sowie Portal 2 richtig geniale meiner Meinung nach Denk-Spiele. Macht richtig laune es zu zocken und man freut sich hin und wieder wenn man was richtig gemacht hat und diese wundervolle stimme einen Fertig macht :D einfach genial !

Portal is one of the best games ever made. Whichever way you look at it: its utilitarian art design is striking, in its minimalism a mirror of the sleek game design. No frills, because none are needed. The game is straightforward, has a perfect learning curve and so far is utterly unbeaten in the way it manages to evoke both dread and amusement at the same time.
And it gave us GlaDOS, probably one of the best-realized game villains to ever grace our monitors.

Holy crap. I planned on just playing this for an hour or so before going to sleep... yeah ... it's SO AMAZING and SO ADDICTIVE (while beingly slightly confusing in an engage-your-mind-in-the-weirdest-friggin-way) that it is now almost 3:20 AM and I have to wake up for school in three hours. 


SO. WORTH. IT.
I simply recomend this game, I may have not ma lot of time but, that was because I played it before on another user, If you just want to sit back with awesome puzzles and story pick this up

The game is very well developed. The graphics contect is very high for 2007. I'm playing this now in 2013!! The first-person concept instead of 3rd or over view makes the game more worth it. The levels are truly mind twisting! There are a lot of different ways to play like gaining velocity, staying away from water, getting blocks to a point, etc. I reccomend this game to all ages!

Although it took me no time to finish the game, I enjoyed every bit of the game and will not get bored even if I played it again several times. Overall, I give this game a very good rating, very well designed.

No cakewalk this one

This is one clever game. The concept is simple but brilliant: you’re trapped in the labs of Aperture Science and you have to get out. To assist you you’re given a portal gun. The gun opens doorways in almost any surface. Once you have full control of the gun you can create blue and amber portals. Step into the blue one and you emerge from the amber one, step into the amber one and you emerge from the blue one. By positioning the portals in certain ways you can step, jump,  or fall huge distances. You can also use them to redirect lasers and bullets, which you must do in order to stay alive. All through your efforts to escape you’re teased and goaded by GLaDoS, the AI that runs the lab. As with all Valve games the writing is excellent, with GLaDoS delivering some perfectly-pitched lines (and a cute little song at the end). Each challenge is more difficult than the last but none is so frustrating as to annoy, and all are satisfying when solved. My only criticism is that the maps lack variety as you travel from one austere lab to another, or from one utility area to another (this appears to have been addressed in Portal 2, which offers a wider range of environments). All-in-all this is one of the most imaginative games I’ve ever encountered. Check out the Orange Box though, because this offers the excellent Half-Life 2 games and Portal as a bundle and is great value.

4/5

Portal is now quite an old game but I have just recently bought it (on sale $2.25!). It works great on Linux (I run Ubuntu 12.04).
However the single player story is quite short. I spent less than 5 hours to get through. For a game on sale this cheap its ok, but if you pay full price maybe not so much so. I played Portal2 before this one, maybe its a giveaway on some of the mecanics in the puzzles, I dont know.
But overall its a great story... I am happy hat I now know how the story began, what I could only guess whie playing Portal2.
I am looking forward to all the other stuff you can do, the achievements that are just waiting to be found/fulfilled.
I guess there is at least another 5 hours worth of unique gaming in Portal.

Oh, I nearly forgot. The cake is a lie!

The psycological experience, the amazing atmosphere and the depth of story in Portal can be explained with two words: Still Alive.

It may be short, but isn't that better than a puzzle game that goes on so long that you give up? The singleplayer doesn't offer much replay value, as once you've solved the puzzles you pretty much create a portal to the end of the game, but there are still Challenge and Bonus Maps. Once the community gets going, countless others will follow. The fact that I went through the entire game again to just hear the ending song says it all. Portal is beautiful, having an electric atmosphere and experience.

Portal. A great start to a series. In this series you play another character who does not speak, but this time your name isn't Gordon Freeman. You are Chell, traversing through Aperture Science Laboratories where you have been captured. Travel in hope of cake and escaping, using your Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device, also known as the Portal Gun. You'll meet robots who don't mind who you are, they just want to kill you, but no hard feelings! Cubes are your best friends and large, female robots your worst enemies! Sit back and enjoy the lifts in Portal!
Excellent puzzle game, very funny as well
Interesting and challenging puzzles, as well as some of the most hilariously dark writing I've heard in a video game. Highly recommended.
Portal is a very fun and puzzling game. If you want a semi-peaceful challenge, buy this game.
